Reservoir13: Do not be fooled this is not a "mystery" novel, though there is a mystery at its heart
McGregor uses a young girl's disappearance as a jumping off point to investigate the inner workings of village life, the flow of time and memory
While the prose is beautiful I will admit that I did not enjoy the experience of reading the book, I often felt impatient and a little bit bored - but I LOVE the experience of having finished it
I think about it often; it haunts you (as the young girl haunts the village) long after you finish
This is "The English Patient" of mystery novels
